name: Acid Burns
description: Classic 303-style acid showcase featuring aggressive resonance and snappy envelopes

performance.notes: High bite value (0.9) creates screaming resonance. Low rubber (0.1) produces snappy, percussive envelopes. Pattern probability (0.85-0.95) adds subtle variation without losing the groove.
performance.technique: Use the decay knob to open the filter. Bite controls both filter resonance and envelope brightness. Rubber affects glide timing - keep low for acid.

musicalPattern.transcription: E2 (36) → G#2 (39) → B2 (43) pattern classic 303 rhythm. Accented notes on beats 1, 5, 9, 13. Probability drops occasional notes for rhythmic interest.

audioCharacteristics.stereoPlacement: Center with slight width from resonance

whyThisSong.educational: Demonstrates LOCAL_GAL's unique 'bite' parameter and pattern sequencer
whyThisSong.showcase: High bite + probability creates the classic acid techno sound
whyThisSong.obscure: Pattern probability is often overlooked - adds generative variation

implementation.swift:
let assignment = InstrumentAssignment(
    name: "Acid Bass",
    type: .synth,
    channel: 1,
    plugin: PluginInfo(
        id: "LOCAL_GAL",
        name: "Local Gal Acid Synth",
        manufacturer: "Schillinger Ecosystem",
        parameters: [
            "rubber": 0.1,
            "bite": 0.9,
            "hollow": 0.3,
            "growl": 0.4
        ]
    )
)

try manager.assignInstrument(trackId: "acid-bass", instrument: assignment)
implementation.midi: Channel 1: E2-G#2-B2 pattern with accent on beats 1, 5, 9, 13

tips: Increase bite gradually during the track for tension
Use pattern probability to add variation without losing the groove
Keep rubber low for authentic acid feel
Try automating cutoff filter for sweeps
